content:
I think your ideas are absolutely lovely! Both options you suggested would create a beautiful and elegant centerpiece that honors your grandmother's vase and adds a personal touch to the dinner party.

The first option, with a few fresh flowers like roses or calla lilies around a single, long-stemmed candle, is a classic and timeless choice. The greenery, like eucalyptus or ferns, will add a nice texture and depth to the arrangement, and the candle will provide a warm and inviting glow.

The second option, with a small bouquet of fresh flowers like baby's breath or Queen Anne's lace around the candle, is a beautiful and delicate choice. The halo effect will add a touch of romance and whimsy to the centerpiece, and the soft, feathery texture of the flowers will create a lovely contrast with the smooth, elegant vase.

Both options are simple yet elegant, and they will allow the beauty of the vase to shine through. I think your grandmother would be proud to see her vase being used in such a lovely way.

Which one do you think you might prefer? Or do you want to experiment with both options and see which one looks best with the vase and the overall theme of the dinner party?
